title: Library Contract Request: Lexis Nexis at Cincinnati State

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with LexisNexis, a division of RELX Inc., relating to the licensing of LexisNexis Academic (Nexis Uni);

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with Lexis Nexis and RELX Inc. for licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of LexisNexis Academic (Nexis Uni).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

M

title: Library contract request: IEEE at University of Georgia

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract, governing, base, or master license agreement with THE INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONICS ENGINEERS, INCORPORATED (“IEEE”) relating to the licensing of IEEE Xplore Digital Library;

All related terms and conditions, terms of service, amendments, addenda, appendices, attachments, product terms, MOUs, MOAs, data processing agreements, and/or letters of intent; and

All financial documents or records of financial transactions, exchanges or obligations related to the contractual relations with IEEE for journal licensing. 

Responsive materials include all contracts, agreements, amendments, appendices, invoices, and any other documents listed above that incorporate language governing terms of use of IEEE Xplore Digital Library.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M

title: Count of 5471 Forms Filed in tax years 2017-2024

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Count of 5471 Forms Filed in tax years 2017-2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking a count of Form 5471s that were filed to / processed by the IRS in tax years 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024 (noting that the filing season has not yet completed for 2024).  

If it is possible to distinguish between forms filed from a non-US address and forms filed from a US state, that would additionally be helpful. Similarly, if it can be identified what number of forms are attached to a personal 1040 return each year, that would additionally be responsive. 

I checked OMB control numbers 1545-0074 and 1545-0123, but these relate to the omnibus individual & business tax return filings, rather than this specific form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Lee

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Columbia/Barnard "Jewish" Text Message Survey
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the recent survey sent to Barnard College & Columbia University staff which has been widely reported by the media (e.g. https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/23/nyregion/barnard-faculty-eeoc-text-jewish.html, https://www.columbiaspectator.com/news/2025/04/23/eeoc-sends-texts-to-columbia-and-barnard-employees-asking-them-to-complete-survey-for-title-vii-investigation/, https://theintercept.com/2025/04/23/trump-eeoc-barnard-columbia-texts-jewish/).
2. The results of the survey.
3. Any contracts or invoices with 3rd party firms hired in part or in full to assist in the creation, dissemination, or analysis this or other survey data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss
